title: Question 4
prompt:
Sentence 12: Though Amanda has been a valuable asset during her time with us.

Which correction should be made to sentence 12?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
When it appears at the beginning of a clause, “though” is a subordinating conjunction, which is a word that shows how a part of a sentence relates to the rest of the sentence. Subordinating conjunctions are words like though, although, which,if, because, when, where, unless, until, and since. A clause that begins with a subordinating conjunction cannot stand on its own, even if it has a subject and verb in it. The simplest way to make this into a complete sentence is to delete the word “though.”


Amanda has been a valuable asset during her time with us.
